entity.name: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins for Stand Up to Cancer
entity.description: In `Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins', twelve well-known public figures from the worlds of entertainment, sports and politics embark on the one of the toughest tests of their lives as they try to pass a unique version of the infamous SAS Selection test over a gruelling seven-day period, led by tough chief instructor Ant Middleton and his team of staff - Foxy, Billy, Ollie and Jay - who don't care how famous the recruits are, how many followers they have, or what they have done until now. As soon as they enter the selection process their celebrity status vanishes. Will the celebs have what it takes to make it through this unique version of SAS selection?

tweets.text: I just made my first complaint to the @ICOnews, as the @EnvAgency has failed to give me a proper response *four and a half months* after I made my initial Environmental Information Regulations request. It's supposed to respond within 20 working days. It's been 97. @CampaignFoI.

@GarethSimkins @tayz_BETH @ICOnews @EnvAgency @CampaignFoI They‚Äôre apparently overloaded with dealing with Walleys Quarry complaints and FOI requests, if they‚Äôd regulated it properly in the first place & actually addressed the matter with the urgency it deserves they wouldn‚Äôt be having that problem

urls.description: Favourite recreation spot and chalk stream hit by 79 million litres of sludge.

tweets.text:

https://t.co/BFSxvEMlp0

@OdourConsultant @EnvAgency @PHE_uk @StinkStopthe We feel a bit stuck in terms of awaiting EA action whilst people have to suffer in the meantime. Have you managed to look at the EA updates at all? If you could dm to let me know what you could offer that would be great üòÄüëç

tweets.text: The landfill stench and the health issues are affecting a community. Our homes are now our prisons, we cannot open our windows or use our gardens. Hydrogen sulphide is in our schools and hospital Pls show support and help us stop this @kdlang @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink https://t.co/HzVXNUKtb3
@janifranck @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency Hi Jez, I am sorry ,nothing at the moment. Rest be assured that it is in hand & our team will look into this.

I *really* like this approach from @EnvAgency but am not convinced by the bottom right results. Avoided emissions are permanent per se; switching to 'permanent emissions reductions' misleadingly priorises offset over reduction. Or have I missed something?https://t.co/r6vNFsCTXf https://t.co/WJgFK3vFbD

Worsening of asthma & sleep deprivation in the local population. Chart of EA monitoring data comparing March & April 2021 shows nighttime annoyance levels above 85%! Nicky relates her latest asthma review. Someone explain how this is acceptable? @PHE_uk @StinkStopthe @DefraGovUK https://t.co/QPF1hIDh6p

@xandermahony @EnvAgency If I save a tonne of carbon in one year from insulating my house, that is as permanent as if I sequester a tonne of carbon in a forest. 

If after 30 years my insulation stops functioning, that's not the equivalent of my forest burning down, but of it ceasing to expand.
